title: Ptolemy's table of chords
summary: The table of chords, created by the Greek astronomer, geometer, and geographer Ptolemy in Egypt during the 2nd century AD, is a trigonometric table in Book I, chapter 11 of Ptolemy's Almagest,[1] a treatise on mathematical astronomy.  It is essentially equivalent to a table of values of the sine function.
